intro: Streptochaeta angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf streptochaeta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal regions. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
